page.title: 12PARISH HALL,BURRINGTON
page.content: {PARISH HALL AND MEN'S CLUB} When Burrington ex-soldiers returned after World War I they wanted to form a{Comrades Club,}so Major General Sir Arnold Taggart of Northcote Manor bought a wooden army hut and Mr.W.E. Short gave the site.In{1929}a splendid { Parish Hall}was erected by means of a loan from Lt.Col. Gracey of Northcote Manor. The Hall was linked to the {Men's Club}by a corridor.In 1943-44 fire in the corridor resulted in the destruction of both buildings.The site was cleared pending the removal of building restrictions. After the war a temporary corrugated asbestos building, looking like a giant{maggot, was erected to serve as{Club and {Parish Hall.}The present magnificent Hall was built in{1959,}financed by grants and local efforts.The extension to the mens club was built in{1978.
